description: This class will introduce students to the basic vocabulary and style of Caribbean social dances such as Compas, Zouk, Twoubadou and Calypso. This high energy class can be taught to anyone with a passion to move, so no dance experience is required.
name: Top: Contemp Caribbean Social Dance

revisions.description: Students explore dance genres that embody a strong rhythmic foundation. They experience rhythmic pattern as an organizing principle for the human body, an expressive capacity, and a social connector. Students investigate the cultural and social milieu from which dance genres emerge. Dance genres could include, hip hop, African, Asian, and Caribbean dance forms, tap dance, or jazz dance. Offered periodically.

title: Topics in Rhythm in Dance
